text: Brian Kent Kobilka (born May 30, 1955) is an American physiologist. He is best known for his work with G protein-coupled receptors, for which he was awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize for Chemistry with Robert Lefkowitz.He is currently a professor in the department of Molecular and Cellular Physiology at Stanford University School of Medicine. He was named a member of the National Academy of Sciences in 2011. == References == ==Other websites== * Kobilka laboratory home page * Brian Kobilka academic profile * ConfometRx home page * Nobel Biography Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:American physiologists Category:Scientists from Minnesota Category:Stanford University faculty Category:Educators from Minnesota
title: Brian Kobilka
